item.title: Post your Screenshot!
item.dc:creator: Dreadmoth
item.description:
geekofalltrades:
Dreadmoth:

Ratchet & Clank (PCSX2 v1.5.0-dev-1457-gc440c7c):
Ratchet & Clank 3: Up Your Arsenal (PCSX2 v1.5.0-dev-1358-gc272359):

Wait, did PCSX2 FINALLY fix the mipmapping issue!?

Yep
Performance improved a bit with the implementation of mipmapping as well. On most planets, I’ve been able to run R&C at full speed on 60Hz mode.
Ratchet & Clank and R&C2 are almost perfect in hardware rendering now. R&C3 looks fine for the most part, but bloom effects can be a bit iffy at resolutions above native.
Some games that benefit from mipmapping still suffer from other, separate texture cache issues (e.g. Jak 3).

Ratchet & Clank (PCSX2 v1.5.0-dev-1909-gae8aa35):

1920×1080

1920×1080

1920×1080

(Platinum PAL version has a “Galactron” (instead of Gadgetron) sign on Kalebo III for some reason)

Think I’ll need to plug in a controller for the hoverboard races…

EDIT:

Dungeon Siege:

1920×1080

Finally finished Dungeon Siege a few weeks ago.

Read full topic

Dungeon Siege:

1920×1080

Whee[/size]

1920×1080

Still holds up reasonably well. Shame the complex shadow options wreck performance due to compatibility problems with new hardware / drivers / OS.
(Simple shadows: 120 FPS (v-sync). All Complex shadows: <40 FPS in some areas. Even party-only complex shadows can result in drops below 60 FPS…)

Base fully upgraded, now to wait for more buildings…

Replays “coming soon”, will take better gameplay screenshots then

item.title: Post your Screenshot!
item.dc:creator: Dreadmoth
item.description:
Armored Warfare (open beta):

1024×576

From level 2 - 4, small details of base structures change (fences, light posts, sandbags, etc.). At level 5 they get a new model.
I might have everything upgraded to level 5 before they release the rest of the base structures (Port, etc.).

Fallout 4:

1920×1080

Ran at 7680x4320 to see how it’d run. 5 FPS (interesting compared to the SW: Battlefront Beta, which ran much more smoothly at 1920x1080 than Fallout 4 does - guess some effects scale differently).
Think some textures didn’t load in fully for this shot, oh well. Texture streaming is a bit sluggish even in normal gameplay (installed on SSD :meh: ).

Grim Dawn:

1920×1080

Looks, runs and plays better with each new update. Looking forward to the full release.

1920×1080

New cave flora looks nice.

Read full topic

item.title: Post your Screenshot!
item.dc:creator: Dreadmoth
item.description:
The Witcher - Enhanced Edition

□
□

Champions: Return to Arms (PCSX2)

□

Snowblind engine games (at least Champions of Norrath and Baldur’s Gate: Dark Alliance series) now work pretty well with GSDX hardware rendering modes in recent Git builds of PCSX2. Just make sure to use “scaled” resolutions (2x native, etc.) rather than custom resolutions.

EDIT: Minus ate my screenshots
